store_url.title: Store URL
store_url.description: Your shop domain name, e.g. https://myshop.com

#consumer_key.title: Consumer Key
#consumer_key.description: Rest API Consumer Key from WooCommerce Admin panel

#consumer_secret.title: Consumer secret
#consumer_secret.description: Rest API Consumer Secret from WooCommerce Admin panel

query_string_auth.title: Include authorization keys in query string
query_string_auth.description: Select this option if you receive 401 errors from your server. Some servers may have issues with standard Authorization header processing.

load_type.title: Load type
load_type.description: If set to Incremental update, the result tables will be updated based on primary key. Full load overwrites the destination table each time. NOTE: If you wish to remove deleted records, this needs to be set to Full load and the Period from attribute empty.

fetching_mode.title: Fetching mode
fetching_mode.description: If set to Basic Incremental Fetching, data will be fetched using the before and after parameters of the WooCommerce Api. Full Download downloads all data. Custom Incremental Fetching allows the use of custom incremental fetching parameters

date_from.title: From date [inclusive]
date_from.description: Date from. Date in YYYY-MM-DD format or a string i.e. 5 days ago, 1 month ago, yesterday, etc. If left empty, all records are downloaded.

date_to.title: To date [exclusive]
date_to.description: Date to. Date in YYYY-MM-DD format or a string i.e. 5 days ago, 1 month ago, yesterday, etc. If left empty, all records are downloaded.

custom_incremental_field.title: Custom Incremental Parameter
custom_incremental_field.description: Custom parameter in WooCommerce for incremental fetching

custom_incremental_value.title: Custom From date
custom_incremental_value.description: Date from for the custom incremental fetching parameter. Date in YYYY-MM-DD format or a string i.e. 5 days ago, 1 month ago, yesterday, etc.

endpoint.title: Endpoint
endpoint.description: To fetch data from selected endpoints i.e. Customers, Orders and Products. Note that the Customers endpoint is not affected by the selected period.

flatten_metadata_values.title: Flatten Metadata values
flatten_metadata_values.description: Split object metadata table values into multiple columns if the value is an object (product__metadata, order__metadata, order_line__metadata, etc.). If set to true the values will be split into multiple column generating columns like value__discount_details_xxx.
